body: Are you interested in shipping more colorschemes? I have Gruvbox light and dark ready to commit, if so. :)

I put solarized in there mostly as a sanity check that switching between colorschemes works live. I wouldn't be opposed to having a folder of these in the repo, but I can imagine that over time it would become responsible for a disproportionate number of commits.

How do you feel about starting a color schemes page in the Wiki?
It appears wiki editing is restricted to collaborators.
I think it should work now.

issue.title: Add option to disable dynamic title
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?
Linux Hermes 4.13.3-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Sep 21 20:33:16 CEST 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux

If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?
X11

Termite has a great feature that allows you to disable dynamic title:
```
dynamic_title = false
```

It would be great to have such a feature in alacritty. Otherwise, for me the title will stay `tmux`. Another nice option would be to be able to set the title. I would like to set it to `terminal`.

issue.title: Jumping word by word using control + arrow keys doesn't works in vim
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?
Arch Linux(Linux y50 4.13.12-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Nov 8 11:54:06 CET 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux)

If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?
X11

Usually, Pressing Ctrl+Left/Right arrow keys makes the cursor jump word by word in left or right direction in vim. 

In alacritty, When I press Ctrl+Left Arrow Key, It enters `:5D` in command mode in vim and pressing Ctrl+Right arrow key enters `:5C` in command mode. 

I tried fixes like putting `set nocompatible` and `set nocp` in my `.vimrc` but it doesn't works. 

`od -a` output for Left and Right arrow keys. 
Left Arrow key -> `^[[1;5D`
Right Arrow key -> `^[[1;5C`

Is there some way to make arrow keys work in vim? I am not comfortable with using hjkl yet and not having arrow keys to help is slightly frustrating. 

Thanks. 
PS: This project is awesome. I have a few suggestions and PRs, I'll create seperate issues for those.

issue.title: Allow TOML configuration files
issue.body: I personally prefer using TOML to YAML, and at least allowing an alacritty.toml instead of alacritty.yml would be nice.

issue.title: Wrong window size detected
issue.body:
I searched for "wrong window size" in the issues but haven't found any
relevant.

# System

|                  |                                                                         |
|------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Operating System | Linux 5.2.0-2-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.2.9-2 (2019-08-21) x86_64 GNU/Linux |
| Rust Version     | nightly                                                                 |
| Display Server   | X11                                                                     |
| Window Manager   | DWM                                                                     |
| Compositor       | none (?)                                                                |

# Summary

Alacritty detects the wrong window size at startup.

# Behavior

This happens only on my larger monitor (see `xrandr` output below, if
relevant), and even with "split" windows. This does happen very often, but not
everytime, and I haven't figured out why. I started using Alacritty from commit
`f3cc7c4` and, as far as I remember, this only started on a commit from a few
weeks ago.

While writing this I installed `f3cc7c4`, and it's consistently working fine.
I'll keep it for a while just in case.

# Expectation

Alacritty should correctly detect the window size at startup.

# Extra

issue.title: all alacritty windows stop drawing and accepting input simultaniously without a clear cause
issue.body:
After some amount of time, all (or at least many: I don't have a record of less than all occuring, the most recent occurrence was 5 windows, which were all the ones I had open) alacritty windows in my session (I have not tried multiple x11 servers, etc) simultaneously stop re-drawing. They also don't appear to process keyboard input (pressing `ctrl-D` a number of times on a window that was only running a shell does not close them). Additionally, using my normal i3-keybind to close windows does not work, I've ended up using xkill to close the alacritty processes.

The content of the alacritty windows isn't updated, and instead just displays the last drawn content for that area of my screen (so switching to a desktop showing a picture and then switching to the frozen alacritty windows shows a the picture where those alacritty windows are.

Other x11 clients (zoom, firefox, evince) appear unaffected and continue to operate normally. 

Potentially related, but perhaps coinciental: `xlsclients` does not show any alacritty processes (either the functional ones or the non-functional ones).

Starting new alacritty processes works fine (new alacritty windows work while the "frozen" ones remain "frozen").

I have observed the "freeze" to occur while typing into one of the windows. I have also switched back to a desktop with alacritty windows to find them frozen (with no indication of when this occured).

I previously had alacritty working without issue, so the is probably being triggered/exposed by some other recent package update/change on my system. Because of the non-determinism in the event, I don't know change/upgrade caused it.

issue.title: Alacritty extremely slow on one display output, but not on the other
issue.body:
I don't know how to test for this but I am trying my hardest to figure it out. I have two monitors, one using a DVI output and the other using HDMI. Sometimes I change my Xrandr settings to test monitors or projectors, but this weird issue keeps happening. After a while, Alacritty does not perform well on my HDMI monitor, but continues to operate perfectly fine on my DVI monitor in parallel.

I suspect this might have something to do with OpenGL or another such issue and isn't Alacritty's fault, maybe even a fault with X11 and I should switch to Wayland/sway. Alacritty's performance continues to be fine and responsive under DVI, but for my HDMI monitor, booting up a fresh Alacritty terminal, pressing keys, and even closing it all takes significantly longer to respond. Moving an Alacritty instance from my DVI to the HDMI is also affected.
